DescriptionExternalHTML:
Job Purpose:

A Research Associate will join the research group to work on one main project supported by a grant from Healthcare Engineering and Innovation Center. The project aims to develop wearable robotic and sensing devices for rehabilitation, compensation, and/or augmentation.  The RA’s work will heavily involve in system modeling, design, fabrication and validation. Moreover, the candidate will support in experimental activities at KU Gait Labs (L01002), and maintenance of custom robotic systems available in the project.  The Research Associate appointment is for a period of eleven months (Feb 2024 – Dec 2024), extendable based on research budget availability. The Research Associate will provide support and undertake internationally competitive research and development on industrially relevant problems, aiming to provide innovative solutions, intellectual property development and high-quality peer reviewed publications, thereby contributing to the academic and research mission of the university.  The position is funded by research grants, and it is contingent on research funding.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Contribute to the development of wearable robotics and wearable sensing devices.  
  • On board implementation of sensor fusion methodologies and technologies
  • Implementation of several control systems followed by the standard control protocols of rehabilitation devices; 
  • Conduction of experiments in the Gait lab at KU Labs (L01002) 
  • Participate in scientific research as a professionally responsible member of the research team, participate in problem exploration and definition, planning of the approach and sequence of steps, execution of experiments and studies, interpretation of findings, documentation and reporting of results and progress, maintenance of research records and compliance to all established policies and procedures; 
  • Contribute to the overall activities of the research team as required;
  • Contribute to publishing research results in high quality journals appropriate to the field in a timely manner;Operational Responsibilities:
  • Regularly meets with the project Supervisor to apprise the Supervisor of the research results, for the development and troubleshooting of techniques, to provide advice and to express mutual expectations; 
  • Monitors and orders equipment, consumables, components, and other materials for the experimental part of the project. 
  • Support the PI in preparing reports, administrative aspects related to the project, as well as any other assigned duties by the PI.Supervisory Responsibilities:
  • Present research plans and findings in a convincing style, both in oral and written modes of communication, understand research group management and supervision of others, including the assistance to undergraduate and graduate students, establish contacts with colleagues pursuing a similar research agenda
